keywordspec.name: AWSLibrary
keywordspec.doc:
AWSLibrary is a testing library for Robot Framework that gives you the ability to use some of the AWS services in your tests. This robot library is made from Boto3 SDK
| ***** Settings ***** | Library AWSLibrary | | | ***** Variables ***** | ${REGION} eu-west-1 | ${BUCKET} some-bucket-name | | | ***** Test Cases ***** | Test Case | [Setup] Create Session With Keys ${REGION} %{AWS_USER_NAME} %{AWS_USER_PASS} | S3 Upload File ${BUCKET} new_file.json ${CURDIR}/local_file.json | S3 Key Should Exist ${BUCKET} new_file.json | S3 Key Should Not Exist ${BUCKET} local_file.json | ${file_inside_folder} S3 List Objects ${BUCKET} folder_name | Log List ${file_inside_folder} | S3 Download File ${BUCKET} new_file.json ${CURDIR}/new_local_file.json | S3 Delete File ${BUCKET} new_file.json | [Teardown] Delete All Sessions

kw.name: Create Bucket
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Create Bucket` instead
Creates S3 Bucket with the given bucket name
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. |
*Examples:* | Create bucket _name | bucket_name |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Create Bucket` instead

kw.name: Create Session With Keys
kw.doc:
Create an AWS session in region using your access key and secret key.
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``region`` | <str> The AWS region name. | | ``access_key`` | <str> the access key. | | ``secret_key`` | <str> the secret key. |
*Examples:* | Create Session With Keys | eu-west-1 | access_key | secret_key |
kw.shortdoc: Create an AWS session in region using your access key and secret key.

kw.name: Create Session With Profile
kw.doc:
Create an AWS session in region with your profile stored at ~/.aws/config.
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``region`` | <str> The AWS region name. | | ``profile`` | <str> the profile name. |
*Examples:* | Create Session With Profile | us-west-1 | profile_name |
kw.shortdoc: Create an AWS session in region with your profile stored at ~/.aws/config.

kw.name: Create Session With Token
kw.doc:
Create an AWS session in region using access key, secret key and token.
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``region`` | <str> The AWS region name. | | ``access_key`` | <str> the access key. | | ``secret_key`` | <str> the secret key. | | ``token`` | <str> the user token. |
*Examples:* | Create Session With Token | eu-west-1 | access_key | secret_key | token |
kw.shortdoc: Create an AWS session in region using access key, secret key and token.

kw.name: Delete All Sessions
kw.doc:
Delete all current sessions.
*Examples:* | Delete All Sessions |
kw.shortdoc: Delete all current sessions.

kw.name: Delete File
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Delete File` instead
Deletes the file from a bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete filepath. |
*Examples:* | Delete File | bucket_name | file.txt | | Delete File | bucket_name | folder/file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Delete File` instead

kw.name: Delete Session
kw.doc:
Delete session by entering the region.
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``region`` | <str> The AWS region name. |
*Examples:* | Delete Session | us-west-1 |
kw.shortdoc: Delete session by entering the region.

kw.name: Download File
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Download File` instead
Download file from a bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete filepath. | | ``path`` | <str> Complete local filepath. |
*Examples:* | Download File | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | ${OUTPUTDIR}/file.txt | | Download File | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt | ${OUTPUTDIR}/file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Download File` instead

kw.name: Key Should Exist
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Key Should Exist` instead
Check if the s3 object exist inside the bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. |
*Examples:* | Key Should Exist | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | | Key Should Exist | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Key Should Exist` instead

kw.name: Key Should Not Exist
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Key Should Not Exist` instead
Check if the s3 object not exist inside the bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. |
*Examples:* | Key Should Not Exist | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | | Key Should Not Exist | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Key Should Not Exist` instead

kw.name: List Objects
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 List Objects` instead
List objects in a bucket. (up to 1,000) each request
If prefix is informed will list only the files that start with this string, could be used to list only the files inside a folder for example.
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``Prefix`` | <str> prefix of the filepath. |
*Examples:* | List Objects | bucket_name | | List Objects | bucket_name | folder_name | | List Objects | bucket_name | folder_name/start_of_the_filename |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 List Objects` instead

kw.name: Local File Should Exist
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0*
Verifies Local File at the given path does exist Requires: @param: ```path``` which is the bucket location/path name. Example: | Local File Should Exist | bucket | path |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0*

kw.name: Local File Should Not Exist
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0*
Verifies Local File at the given path does not exist Requires: @param: ```path``` which is the bucket location/path name. Example: | Local File Should Not Exist | bucket | path |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0*

kw.name: S3 Create Bucket
kw.doc:
Creates S3 Bucket with the given bucket name
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. |
*Examples:* | S3 Create bucket | bucket_name |
kw.shortdoc: Creates S3 Bucket with the given bucket name

kw.name: S3 Delete File
kw.doc:
Deletes the file from a bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. |
*Examples:* | S3 Delete File | bucket_name | file.txt | | S3 Delete File | bucket_name | folder/file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: Deletes the file from a bucket

kw.name: S3 Download File
kw.doc:
Download file from a bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. | | ``local_path`` | <str> Complete local filepath. |
*Examples:* | S3 Download File | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | ${OUTPUTDIR}/file.txt | | S3 Download File | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt | ${OUTPUTDIR}/file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: Download file from a bucket

kw.name: S3 Key Should Exist
kw.doc:
Check if the s3 object exist inside the bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. |
*Examples:* | S3 Key Should Exist | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | | S3 Key Should Exist | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: Check if the s3 object exist inside the bucket

kw.name: S3 Key Should Not Exist
kw.doc:
Check if the s3 object not exist inside the bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. |
*Examples:* | S3 Key Should Not Exist | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | | S3 Key Should Not Exist | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: Check if the s3 object not exist inside the bucket

kw.name: S3 List Objects
kw.doc:
List objects in a bucket. (up to 1,000) each request
If prefix is informed will list only the files that start with this string, could be used to list only the files inside a folder for example.
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``Prefix`` | <str> prefix of the filepath. |
*Examples:* | S3 List Objects | bucket_name | | S3 List Objects | bucket_name | folder_name | | S3 List Objects | bucket_name | folder_name/start_of_the_filename |
kw.shortdoc: List objects in a bucket. (up to 1,000) each request

kw.name: S3 Upload File
kw.doc:
Upload a file to the bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. | | ``local_path`` | <str> Complete local filepath. |
*Examples:* | S3 Upload File | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | ${CURDIR}/file.txt | | S3 Upload File | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt | ${CURDIR}/file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: Upload a file to the bucket

kw.name: Upload File
kw.doc:
*DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Upload File` instead
Upload a file to the bucket
| =Arguments= | =Description= | | ``bucket`` | <str> The bucket name. | | ``key`` | <str> complete s3 filepath. | | ``path`` | <str> Complete local filepath. |
*Examples:* | Upload File | bucket_name | s3_file.txt | ${CURDIR}/file.txt | | Upload File | bucket_name | folder/s3_file.txt | ${CURDIR}/file.txt |
kw.shortdoc: *DEPRECATED - this keyword will be removed in version 2.0.0* use `S3 Upload File` instead
